result.title: Hack This Code!
result.content:
Hi all!

Have you ever joined a Codeforces Round before? Have you ever wondered what the "Hacks" do? You've come to the right place! In this group, you'll get the chance to hack solutions from all over Codeforces!

The problems will have this format :

Problem : You'll be a given a link to some existing problem on Codeforces.

Code : You'll be linked to some submission to that problem, possibly modified.

Additional Requirements : Might contain some additional requirements for your output.

Your task is to read the problem and the given code, and find a testcase satisfying the original problem condition (you must format it as in the original problem) for which the given solution fails. Additionally, if the Additional Requirements part is nonempty, your testcase must also satisfy the Additional Requirements to be considered valid.

You should write a program that writes the testcase to the standard output. Your testcase will be judged as Accepted if the code given in the link generate a wrong answer.

Hoepfully through hacking you will learn some common frustrating bugs that people make. Good luck and have fun!

P.S. Please do not cheat or attempt to cheat. This contest is unofficial and is just for fun. You will be moved to Practice Mode if you're discovered to be cheating.

UPD : It is recommended to use Codeforces Custom Invocation to check whether your hack works, as your system and Codeforces system might have some differences which produces different results.

Tip : In case you're too lazy to write a program that actually outputs the input, here's a tip. Switch to PHP language, and type the input into the editor like normal.
